conversation.content: Você seriamente acabou de tropeçar no nada?
Ah meu Deus, você viu isso? Eu tava tentando parecer descolado passando por aquele grupo, and my foot just decided to betray me completely.
A recuperação foi impressionante though.
É, bem, quer dizer, transformar aquilo numa corridinha estranha foi, hm, definitivamente não foi meu momento mais suave. Acho que um deles riu de mim mesmo.
Então, uh, você conhecia algum deles, ou tipo, they were just random people?
Eles são da minha oficina de escrita na verdade, which makes it [slowly] muito pior porque agora eu tenho que ver eles toda quinta. Me mata agora.
Ah qual é, ninguém [mocking] lembra dessas coisas.
Tá brincando? Eu ainda, er, lembro quando a Sarah derrubou a bandeja inteira do almoço na sétima série, e, sabe, that was literally 8 years ago! People remember everything embarrassing.
Mas isso é diferente.
Como é diferente? Eu basicamente, hmm, acabei de fazer uma dança interpretativa chamada "Pessoa Descobre a Gravidade" e, tipo, at least 3 people witnessed my shame.
Bem, um, maybe they thought it was, like, cativante ou, na verdade, charmoso?
Ninguém acha tropeçar charmoso! É que, honestly, eu tava me esforçando tanto pra parecer equilibrado naquela aula e, uhh, agora eu sou pra sempre o cara que lutou com escadas invisíveis.
Você tá sendo dramático.

Eu não tô [bored] sendo dramático, I mean, isso vai basicamente definir meu semestre inteiro! Toda crítica na oficina vai começar com eles pensando "ah sim, ele é aquele que, uh, esqueceu como andar."
Eu te prometo que eles já esqueceram.
Você não viu a cara do Marcus - ele fez contato visual direto comigo no meio do tropeço, and I swear I saw his soul leave his body from secondhand embarrassment.
Okay então, err, que tal se você simplesmente, sabe, owned it next class?
Assumir como? Entrar e anunciar "ei pessoal, lembram quando eu, hmm, virei uma girafa bebê aprendendo a andar?" Isso é, bem, somehow even worse!
Só ri sobre isso se alguém mencionar.

Eu sei que você tá certo, é que, um, [empathetically] esses momentinhos parecem tão enormes quando você já tá ansioso sobre se encaixar, sabe? But yeah, acho que, rir disso é provavelmente minha única opção agora.

original_conversation.content: Did you seriously just trip over nothing?
Oh god, you saw that? I was trying to look cool walking past that group and my foot just decided to betray me completely.
The recovery was impressive though.
Yeah, well, I mean, turning it into a weird little jog was, um, definitely not my smoothest moment. I think one of them actually laughed at me.
So, uh, did you know any of them, or like, were they just random people?
They were from my writing workshop actually, which makes it [slowly] so much worse because now I have to see them every Thursday. Kill me now.
Oh come on, nobody [mocking] remembers these things.
Are you kidding? I still, er, remember when Sarah dropped her entire lunch tray in seventh grade, and, you know, that was literally eight years ago! People remember everything embarrassing.
That's different though.
How is it different? I basically, hmm, just performed an interpretive dance called "Person Discovers Gravity" and, I guess, at least three people witnessed my shame.
Well, um, maybe they thought it was, like, endearing or, actually, charming?
Nobody thinks tripping is charming! It's just that, honestly, I've been trying so hard to seem put-together in that class and, uhh, now I'm forever the girl who fought invisible stairs.
You're being dramatic.

I'm not [bored] being dramatic, I mean, this is basically going to define my entire semester! Every workshop critique will start with them thinking "oh right, she's the one who, uh, forgot how to walk."
I promise you they've already forgotten.
You didn't see Marcus's face - he made direct eye contact with me mid-stumble and I swear I saw his soul leave his body from secondhand embarrassment.
Okay so, err, what if you just, you know, owned it next class?
Own it how? Walk in and announce "hey everyone, remember when I, hmm, turned into a baby giraffe learning to walk?" That's, well, somehow even worse!
Just laugh about it if someone brings it up.

I know you're right, it's just that, um, [empathetically] these little moments feel so huge when you're already anxious about fitting in, you know? But yeah, I guess, laughing it off is probably my only option now.
